data.text: @killeen_gerry @StuartDNeilson The collective fever dream that covid is now mild and over and is so deeply upsetting. How long before the reality of the situation catches up with the world?
@prole_choice @StuartDNeilson Good that you see this info is not available. Until it is available, 'experts' need t b careful with their tweets of misinformation......

@killeen_gerry Every 90-120 days, so far. We are seeing 3-4 waves per year, and allowing infection to rise higher with each wave, undoing the benefit of vaccination and improved treatment.
The number of adverse outcomes (illness, hospitalisation and death) in each wave is not falling.
@SeanMurphh1 @StuartDNeilson Why don't you go and look for it on the HSE website? If you find something then maybe *you* can enlighten *us*
@prole_choice @StuartDNeilson I still cannot see if deaths were 'because of' covid or 'with' covid. Please enlighten us....

@StuartDNeilson This wave of acute morbidity and mortality will peak and fade but the public deserves answers to key questions: How high will the peak be? What sustained level will it fade away to? How often to expect subsequent epidemic surges? Expected long term chronic disease burden?

@StuartDNeilson There's no acceptable level of deaths but we know being vaccinated & having your booster reduces the risk of death, so maybe that message needs to be reinforced, especially since there seems to be no appetite for vaccine mandates.
@SeanMurphh1 @StuartDNeilson If you look at the picture, it's clear that this is from a set of graphs of Covid-19 statistics
@GorKeeling @StuartDNeilson @Thisblackwolf @angeliquedeberg @CMOIreland https://t.co/yznpqwzMDi driving has laws, as do open fires, as risks extend past oneself.
